comment._content: Looks like arteries ? Is this evidence of a one time waterway.?

comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content:
@noseum - mary, the dig's photographer, just sent us a response via email: 

Yes, they probably are ancient rivers & streams, but we would need a geologist to tell us how long ago.

comment.author: 27398485@N08
comment._content: Mary, this image is riveting.  Who cares about the window streaks.  How the earth changes.  One school of opinion notes that the Sphinx was built much back further in history.  The theory was presented, it was built when Egypt was a lush tropical area.  I've seen images containing evidence of heavy water erosion on the monument walls, and base areas, along with later wind erosion.  This lush tropics 'might' have existed even more than 10,000 years ago...  Your image reminded me of this theory - of a land where moisture and green jungle like plant life was the rule, not sand and drought.    These ancient rivers and streams illustrate a moisture filled landscape template, very clearly.   One wonders what it must've looked like, when and what happened to change the land so much.  Congrats...great photo catch....  Super time travel.   Pam Eisenberg - Photo Copyright - Orange County Register - Santa Ana, CA .
